sentences.en: Behind his eyes was a whole universe of pain.
sentences.cn: 他眼神中隐藏着无尽的痛楚。

sentences.en: Early astronomers thought that our planet was the centre of the universe.
sentences.cn: 早期的天文学家认为我们的星球是宇宙的中心。

sentences.en: Einstein's equations showed the universe to be expanding.
sentences.cn: 爱因斯坦的方程式表明宇宙正在扩大。

sentences.en: Einstein's equations showed the Universe to be expanding.
sentences.cn: 爱因斯坦的方程式表明宇宙正在膨胀。

sentences.en: Mankind's knowledge of the universe has increased beyond measure.
sentences.cn: 人类对于宇宙的了解已经大为增加。

sentences.en: Our earth is but a part of the universe.
sentences.cn: 我们的地球只是宇宙的一部分.

sentences.en: Our world is but a small part of the universe.
sentences.cn: 我们的世界只是宇宙的一小部分.

sentences.en: Scientists disagree about how the universe was created.
sentences.cn: 科学家对宇宙是怎样形成的有分歧。

sentences.en: The immensity of the universe is difficult to grasp.
the unalterable laws of the universe
The whole universe exists eternally in that one infinite being.
sentences.cn: 整个宇宙在无限的空间中永生。

sentences.en: theories of how the universe began
sentences.cn: 关于宇宙形成的各种理论

sentences.en: They marked out the boundaries of our visual universe.
sentences.cn: 他们标出了我们视觉经验领域的界限。

sentences.en: We cannot yet satisfactorily explain the genesis of the universe.
sentences.cn: 我们仍不能令人满意地解释宇宙的起源.

sentences.en: We still don't know how many galaxies there are in the universe.
sentences.cn: 我们还不知道宇宙中有多少个星系.

words.tran_cn: 普遍的；通用的；宇宙的；全世界的；全体的

phrases.tran_cn: n. 论域；讨论或辩论的范围

trans.tran_en: all space, including all the stars and planets
